title: Relates to the refund to a consumer of money from a used car dealer for failing to correct a malfunction or defect
summary: Establishes when a used car dealer has to refund a consumer his or her money for failing to correct a malfunction or defect as required by the warranty, that such refund may be less an amount equal to twenty-five cents per mile for each mile in excess of the mileage applicable to the vehicle that the vehicle has been driven since the consumer purchased or leased the vehicle from the dealer.

       AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to the refund to a
         consumer of money from a used car dealership for failing to correct  a
         malfunction or defect

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph 1 of subdivision c of section 198-b of the gener-
    2  al business law, as amended by chapter 444  of  the  laws  of  1989,  is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    1. If the dealer or his agent fails to correct a malfunction or defect
    5  as required by the warranty specified in this section which substantial-
    6  ly  impairs  the value of the used motor vehicle to the consumer after a
    7  reasonable period of time, the dealer shall accept return  of  the  used
    8  motor  vehicle  from  the  consumer  and refund to the consumer the full
    9  purchase price, or in the case of a lease  contract  all  payments  made
   10  under  the  contract,  including  sales or compensating use tax, less AN
   11  AMOUNT EQUAL TO TWENTY-FIVE CENTS PER MILE FOR EACH MILE  IN  EXCESS  OF
   12  THE MILEAGE APPLICABLE TO THE VEHICLE CONTAINED IN SUBDIVISION B OF THIS
   13  SECTION THAT THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN DRIVEN SINCE THE CONSUMER PURCHASED OR
   14  LEASED  THE VEHICLE FROM THE DEALER, AND LESS a reasonable allowance for
   15  any damage not attributable to normal wear or usage, and adjustment  for
   16  any  modifications which either increase or decrease the market value of
   17  the vehicle or of the lease  contract,  and  in  the  case  of  a  lease
   18  contract,  shall cancel all further payments due from the consumer under
   19  the lease contract. In determining the purchase price to be refunded  or
   20  in  determining all payments made under a lease contract to be refunded,
   21  the purchase price, or all payments made under a lease  contract,  shall
   22  be  deemed  equal  to the sum of the actual cash difference paid for the
   23  used motor vehicle, or for the  lease  contract,  plus,  if  the  dealer

    2  sale value of any such traded-in vehicles as listed in the National Auto
    3  Dealers Association Used Car Guide, or such other guide as may be speci-
    4  fied  in  regulations promulgated by the commissioner of motor vehicles,
    5  as adjusted for mileage, improvements, and any major physical or mechan-
    6  ical defects in the traded-in vehicle at the time of trade-in. The deal-
    7  er selling or leasing the  used  motor  vehicle  shall  deliver  to  the
    8  consumer a written notice including conspicuous language indicating that
    9  if the consumer should be entitled to a refund pursuant to this section,
   10  the value of any vehicle traded-in by the consumer, if the dealer elects
   11  to not return it to the consumer, for purposes of determining the amount
   12  of  such  refund  will  be  determined by reference to the National Auto
   13  Dealers Association Used Car Guide wholesale value, or such other  guide
   14  as  may  be  approved by the commissioner of motor vehicles, as adjusted
   15  for mileage, improvements, and any major physical or mechanical defects,
   16  rather than the value listed in the sales  contract.  Refunds  shall  be
   17  made  to  the  consumer  and  lienholder, if any, as their interests may
   18  appear on the records of ownership kept by the department of motor vehi-
   19  cles. If the amount to be refunded to the lienholder  will  be  insuffi-
   20  cient  to  discharge  the  lien, the dealer shall notify the consumer in
   21  writing by registered or certified mail that  the  consumer  has  thirty
   22  days to pay the lienholder the amount which, together with the amount to
   23  be refunded by the dealer, will be sufficient to discharge the lien. The
   24  notice  to  the  consumer shall contain conspicuous language warning the
   25  consumer that failure to pay such funds to the lienholder within  thirty
   26  days  will terminate the dealer's obligation to provide a refund. If the
   27  consumer fails to make such payment within thirty days, the dealer shall
   28  have no further responsibility to provide a refund under  this  section.
   29  Alternatively,  the  dealer may elect to offer to replace the used motor
   30  vehicle with a comparably priced vehicle, with such adjustment in  price
   31  as  the  parties  may  agree  to. The consumer shall not be obligated to
   32  accept a replacement vehicle, but  may  instead  elect  to  receive  the
   33  refund  provided  under this section. It shall be an affirmative defense
   34  to any claim under this section that:
   35    (a) The malfunction or  defect  does  not  substantially  impair  such
   36  value; or
   37    (b)  The  malfunction  or  defect  is  the result of abuse, neglect or
   38  unreasonable modifications or alterations of the used motor vehicle.
   39    S 2. Subparagraphs 5 and 6 of paragraph 1 of subdivision f of  section
   40  198-b of the general business law, as separately amended by chapters 444
   41  and 609 of the laws of 1989, are amended to read as follows:

   46  PER  MILE FOR EACH MILE IN EXCESS OF THE MILEAGE APPLICABLE TO THE VEHI-

   48  PURCHASED  OR  LEASED THE VEHICLE FROM THE DEALER, AND LESS a reasonable
   49  allowance for any damage not attributable to normal usage or wear,  and,

   51  you are otherwise required to make under the lease contract.
   52    6. If your car is out of service to repair a problem for  a  total  of
